title: Are Electronics Cheaper in Dubai? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yeah of course as there are no taxes. However if you buy tv then for personal use within UAE it's good but for taking to home country then after paying the taxes there might not be much difference in price. Buying apple products itself if you compare you will major price difference between UAE and other countries. However from 1st Jan 2018 taxes will be implemented then have to see how much will you be benefited pricewise and then can go for buying the electronic item.

Nothing more to answer as others have said earlier.  In general pricing in India is cheaper, except for TV's - unfortunately now Indian customs are slapping a heavy duty on imported TV sets. Whereas many stores in Dubai do list their popular electronics be it mobile or any other items prices are found on their website. You can actually compare this with your local market price for the same models. (e.g. Carrefour Webstore; Sharaf DG; EMax etc). On a given day any item could be cheaper here or in India, difficult to tell. Be aware some of the items like phones with keypads are designed for local market - in that sense you will find Arabic alphabets or numbers - which may be not preferred by many non Arabs but you have add on apps like extension for different languages as well.  Thanks.

Not for all products but yes mostly. But only of you buy from the wholesale market that generally exports to Russia, Iran amd alot of Africa This is espwcially true if you are going to use it in another country and dont need warranty. The only issue is travelling into the market and parking. Its quite crowded and traffic is bad to and from there. However there are a few wholesalers that also do retail and will deliver to your hotel if you place an order with them, one such company is Ashraf Electronics. You can call them on 04-2552015 or email purchasing@ashrafelectronics.com

Based on personal research only: Dubai electronics are normally at US levels. A few years ago, when the euro was much stronger, I was able to save 40% on branded products. Now: 10–15%. Hardly worth the effort, let alone the cost. Electronics retail has become very competitive in Europe due to easy internet price comparisons. In general I think the era of shopping arbitrage is over…!! I am an economist so am very interested in hearing from people who disagree and why.

Yes they are, especially if you are from Africa or East Asia. The region's IT exhibitions- primarily GITEX (A well known 8 day IT expo in Dubai) are known for good deals. Some warehouse sales for gadgets also provide bargain deals. Price differential is particularly high in case of TVs and cameras, and almost zero in smartphones and tablets.  If you are from US or some European states, the answer is a straight 'NO'

Yes, Electronics products are much cheaper in Dubai as compared to other countries like India, Pakistan, US, CN, AU, etc. Here are a numbers of electronic items which you can buy at lower cost in Duai. MobilesMusic equipmentTech GadgetsLaptopsTelevisions, etcBut not all shops in Dubai are selling at good prices, you have to find the right place in order to get lowest deal. Or you can buy the electronics from Souq.com (The biggest online shopping portal in UAE). Souq offer good prices for the original products and the best part is that you can cut the price more or grab the current deals. You can find the deals from 0007.ae Souq Offers

I live in the UAE and prefer buying mobiles and accessories from India. Yes, iphones and Samsung Galaxy flagships are cheaper in UAE but mid range devices are cheaper in India. Examples: OnePlus 3 was 27000 INR and 1600 AED. Xiaomi mi Max was 15000(may be even 14000) and 900 AED. Top end devices like iPhone 7 are cheaper here. 7 is 2600 aed and around 60000 in India and S7 edge is 1900 and 50000 in India. So it just depends on what you want to get. I'm a value for money guy so I'll go for a OnePlus 4 than an iPhone 8 and buy it from India.

Umm, yes! It’s the same price at the official stores like E-max and Sharaf dg etc. But then if you go to places like Naif, there are lots of wholesale shops where you will get electronics for cheap price. but then there wont be any warranty. if you wan’t to shop from the official stores and get the thing at best price, buy during GITEX. Cheers!

Though you are looking for the market from where you can buy electronic products at cheap prices then you should come here. There are many market and streets available in Dubai which you should search and see how you can make your buying process convenient with those easy tips of getting electronic products. Al-Fahidi StreetECityPlug-Ins ElectronixSharaf DGPlugnPointForm these places you can buy cheap electronics.

Depends: cheaper than where? For me: no. I'm from The Netherlands, which is by no means a cheap country, yet I can find almost everything cheaper there, than here. Though I'm probably unaware of the better deals in the back of the industrial estate in Sharjah etc :)

Depends which two locations you are comparing. Asia with dubai? Yes Usa with dubai? No Eu with dubai? Partially And so on. And again if you are constantly looking for more cheaper items you can find deals in many stores/online stores etc.

Yes, in my opinion there are some local brands of electronics in Dubai that are of good quality and are available at a comparatively cheaper price than other cities. For simply drawing comparison you can visit either of shop Al Arab, AWOK or SOUQ.

It depends. I have seen a lot of consumer electronics products that are expensive in Dubai as compared to the US. Except maybe at The UAE's Best Kept Shopping Secret. Seriously. Omar Kassim would definitely agree!!
You can buy cheaper electronics in Dubai Shopping Festival .There are lots of thing to buy in this festival .you can also buy gold in cheaper rate for save your money,
They are cheaper than Indian market. I have purchased online from White Souq : Get best deals on electronics in UAE (TV and accessories) and they were cheaper compared to Indian rates.
